item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 艾伦·凯：预测未来（Predicting The Future） in the user temberature at 2022-05-19T05:35:39
item.description:
in reference to:

在一些数学和科学课程中，他们经常告诉你，最好的方法是改变问题。我认为最好的方法是改变问题陈述的背景。几年前，马文·明斯基说，“你只有通过多种方式才能理解一件事。”（You don’t understand something until you understand it more than one way.）

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:14:02
item.description:
in reference to:

这也解释了仿生阅读为什么妨碍了习惯扫读的读者。对于这些人来说，可能整体高亮关键词、或者高亮句首、段首会更有用。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:15:27
item.description:
in reference to:

从这个角度来讲，仿生阅读也未必适用于所有文章。沈阳师范大学曾做过一项文本标注对中文阅读眼动的研究。研究显示，虽然添加高亮会指引和帮助参与者们更好地记忆重点内容、忽略干扰内容，但如果含有错误标识或标识过多，那与无标识的阅读效率几乎是一样的。同时，如果阅读的文本是比较简单的内容，那标示也未必可以提高正确率。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 加粗几个字母之后，英语阅读速度原地起飞，真的这么神奇吗？ in the user temberature at 2022-06-02T07:16:51
item.description:
in reference to:

加粗分词后的第一个字确实有助于帮助断句、加快阅读。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:54:22
item.description:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:54:57
item.description:
in reference to:

时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T04:55:39
item.description:
in reference to:

说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等 我这些想象的核心，是每日都要练习的一种习惯，类似冥想：打开软件，完成软件呈上的微任务。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:01:24
item.description:
in reference to:

我建造这个东西是为了观察，这样我才能建造这个东西，然后继续这个循环。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:02:44
item.description:
in reference to:

你的 PDF 和电子书阅读器中的标注，可以自然地这个中心化的 SRS 中找到，而不是封存在某个无法访问的侧边栏中。现代操作系统，会根据聊天消息或电子邮件，尝试创建日历事件或建立联系人。类似地，SRS 系统也可能根据你标为书签的链接，或重复搜索的短语，来尝试创建 SRS 卡片。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 将想法送入你的轨道（Orbit） in the user temberature at 2022-06-05T05:05:35
item.description:
in reference to:

记忆：重复回忆问题；时间间隔随着回答成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 过程的流畅性：重复完成简短练习，有许多变体；时间间隔随着成功/失败而呈指数级扩大/缩小 卡片写作：重复问题、模糊的想法、主干想法，从中积累思考，时间跨度为几个月；将卡片标记为「有成果」或「无成果」，以扩大/缩小时间间隔 习惯养成：重复简短的反思卡片，可能根据顺序改变，应用于你的日常经验；间隔默认扩大，但可以放缓 阅读队列：一系列 PDF，标签页，书本，总在变换：如果一段时间内忽略某些内容，它就会暂离一周，之后是一个月；比如说「我现在读够什么了」，这东西就会几天之内再次呈现；说某个东西「不是现在读」，那就几个月，之后是几个月之后再呈现…… 电子邮件收件箱、任务队列、个人通信等

item.description:
in reference to:

人类医学史上第一个真正意义上的对照临床试验。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:16:37
item.description:
in reference to:

对照试验只是一个开始，后来随着安慰剂效应的发现，盲测成为检验疗效另一个强大武器。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 中医这件事 in the user temberature at 2022-06-25T14:17:45
item.description:
in reference to:

所以后来索性把医生的眼睛也蒙起来——不告诉医疗人员哪组是安慰剂组哪组是实验组，所有的结果由第三方机构去统计和评判，这就是双盲对照实验。这种测试最大限度地排除了病人的安慰剂效应和医生的主观偏好，成为了判断药物客观疗效最有力的证据，现代医学的“金标准”。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:22:29
item.description:
in reference to:

some of the reasons have nothing to do with choosing the “best learning tool,” but with regards to how my workflow and my life have changed.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:30:38
item.description:
in reference to:

With the benefit of hindsight, one glaring problem is that, what you do to increase the levels of processing (increasing comprehension and making connections) is beyond the scope of any spaced repetition systems; they’re not conducive to (deep) thinking and making connections.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:35:57
item.description:
in reference to:

But here’s the catch: the connection doesn’t happen automatically. You still have to intentionally and consciously think about the big picture to improve your understanding.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated MasterHowToLearn - Why 99% People Never Learned How To Learn And How to Become That 1% (I) in the user temberature at 2022-08-08T11:44:26
item.description:
in reference to:

From now on, my focus on “how to learn” would be shifted from “when should I review this” to “what should I do when I indeed review this?” It’ll be about thinking frameworks and mental models; it’s about “what and how to think” instead of “when to think.”

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:50:54
item.description:
in reference to:

So when you see something you want to dive into later when you have a bit more time… you have to put it somewhere. That is where a “read-it-later” service like Pocket or Instapaper comes in. Basic features with these services are free, but if you want more advanced features like “search” you have to pay. In the case of Pocket, it will cost you $4.99 a month or $44.99 a year to keep a permanent library of saved articles and be able to search the content of those articles.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Automating Read It Later Articles to DEVONthink - GeekDad in the user temberature at 2022-08-27T04:51:38
item.description:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 年度征文 | 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ - 少数派 in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T03:31:33
item.description:
in reference to:

其实我就能找到之前所有提到该内容的地方，而这个地方的「快」是非常重要的。我常常把 DEVONthink 比作是一栋楼当中的地下室或者是楼阁，当我们需要找什么内容的时候，我们能够非常快速地去找。虽然说平常不会去楼阁里面翻东西，但只要它搜索起来很快，你就能够快速地去找到想要的内容。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated r/devonthink - Is DEVONthink worth it? in the user temberature at 2022-09-01T04:02:11
item.description:
in reference to:

I suppose it depends what you want to use it for. I use it for research mainly. It is excellent for document storage and analysts and it has been a game changer for me. Coupled with its ability with RSS feeds and Devon agent, I have to say it is superb. I suspect I’m only scratching the surface of its capability. It is a pretty steep learning curve but it’s capabilities are massive.Have a look at the videos on www.screencastsonline.com there is a free membership for 7 days which should give you some idea of what it is capable of. They were a great intro for me.

It was shared 300,000 times on Facebook, made the front page of Reddit and became a trending topic on 4chan

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated At What Age Does Our Ability to Learn a New Language Like a Native Speaker Disappear? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:03:33
item.description:
in reference to:

In what could be the most surprising conclusion, the researchers say that even among native speakers it takes 30 years to fully master a language. The study showed a slight improvement—roughly one percentage point—in people who have been speaking English for 30 versus 20 years. The finding is consistent for both native and non-native speakers.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How long does it take to master a language like a native speaker? in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T03:10:21
item.description:
in reference to:

I find that memorizing a number of ‘filler’ words or sentences can greatly increase your ability to come off as native, as well as knowing some expressions and sayings. Instead of expressing agreement with a simple ‘yes’ you could try responding with “you know what? I Agree!” or “I think I see what you mean”. It’s agreement either way but it sounds a lot more ‘native’.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 我是如何艰难地克服「效率成瘾」的？ in the user temberature at 2022-09-02T09:16:14
item.description:
in reference to:

所以说，再举个用好重器 20% 功能的例子，对于 DEVONthink 来说，我觉得它最重要的就是 Search 搜索功能。比如说我通过 Alfred 的 DEVONthink 插件快速输入「重器轻用」，然后我就可以搜到在 DEVONthink 里面所有关于「重器轻用」的信息。而这个搜索速度是极快的，并且在右侧边栏，你可以看到搜索结果有一个展现的区域，让你快速知道哪些地方有相关文字的一个出处。

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:25:14
item.description:
in reference to:

人体对鸡蛋中蛋白质的利用率为 100%，牛奶和肉类蛋白质利用率也同样很高。人体对大多数蔬菜和谷物中的蛋白质的利用率略低于 50%。

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated 碳水化合物、蛋白质和脂肪 - 营养障碍 - 《默沙东诊疗手册大众版》 in the user temberature at 2022-11-02T09:27:38
item.description:
in reference to:

蛋白质通常不用于供应能量。然而，如果人体未从其他营养物质或体内贮存的脂肪中获得足够热量，则会将蛋白质分解为酮体以供应能量。如果蛋白质的消耗量比需要量多，那么人体就会分解蛋白质，然后以脂肪的形式贮存起来。

item.description:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.description:
in reference to:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to Take Smart Notes by Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:02:47
item.description:
in reference to:

What differentiates the Smart Notes method from other note-taking methods is it recognizes that a note is only as useful as the context it is embedded in – its network of associations, relationships, and connections to other ideas.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to Take Smart Notes by Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:04:00
item.description:

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated How to Take Smart Notes by Sonke Ahrens in the user temberature at 2022-11-10T07:07:43
item.description:
in reference to:

Don’t simply copy your notes into a rough draft, but translate them into something coherent and embed them into the context of your argument. As you detect any holes in your argument, fill them in, or change your argument.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 石墨烯电暖产品是真的还是假的？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-11T17:12:14
item.description:
in reference to:

石墨烯地暖目前最大的问题在「涂层」，如果不去做好「封装」，长时间会氧化、粉化及脱落，不可能做到耐用 20 万小时。加上采用丝印工艺，两端涂布不均匀，容易产生「电阻差」，功率不到几年就衰退了，结果就是更耗电而你不自知！

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated (91 封私信 / 80 条消息) 家用的呼吸机、氧气机、清肺仪对轻症以上的新冠病人有多大作用？ - 知乎 in the user temberature at 2022-11-14T06:01:22
item.description:
in reference to:

但奥密克戎病毒的出现改变了这一点，因为这个病毒不嗜肺，不像它的祖先那样经常在肺泡上皮细胞里快速繁殖破坏，所以重症肺炎的比例大幅度下降

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.description:
in reference to:

core.autocrlf Setting this variable to "true" is the same as setting the text attribute to "auto" on all files and core.eol to "crlf". Set to true if you want to have CRLF line endings in your working directory and the repository has LF line endings. This variable can be set to input, in which case no output conversion is performed.

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated Google Colaboratory in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T12:55:17
item.description:
in reference to:

Sections should be large enough to contain enough information to answer a question; but small enough to fit one or several into the GPT-3 prompt. We find that approximately a paragraph of text is usually a good length, but you should experiment for your particular use case.

temberature@hypothes.is said:

item.title: temberature@hypothes.is annotated OpenAI API in the user temberature at 2022-12-13T16:00:10
item.description:
in reference to:

There are two ways to limit the likelihood of the API making up an answer.Provide a ground truth for the API. If you provide the API with a body of text to answer questions about (like a Wikipedia entry) it will be less likely to confabulate a response.Use a low probability and show the API how to say "I don't know". If the API understands that in cases where it's less certain about a response that saying "I don't know" or some variation is appropriate, it will be less inclined to make up answers.
